com.plusauth.android.api

Class Api

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.plusauth.android.api.Api

  • public class Api
extends java.lang.Object
    Api interface for OIDC calls to your OIDC provider. Calls from this class does not alter local Storage so if you want results to persist you must manually handle the Storage.

    • Method Detail

      • setCredentialsManager

        public void setCredentialsManager(CredentialsManager credentialsManager)
        CredentialManager to be used for no arg overload methods. If null, these methods will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        credentialsManager - credential manager

      • getClientId

        public java.lang.String getClientId()

      • userInfo

        public ParameterizableRequest<UserProfile,AuthenticationException> userInfo()
        Calls the user info point of your oidc provider to retrieve profile of the access token's user. Make sure that your accessToken has appropriate scopes such as profile, email etc. or you will get an empty profile with null values.
        Returns:
        request call

      • userInfo

        public ParameterizableRequest<UserProfile,AuthenticationException> userInfo(@NonNull
                                                                            java.lang.String accessToken)
        Calls the user info point of your oidc provider to retrieve profile of the access token's user. Make sure that your accessToken has appropriate scopes such as profile, email etc. or you will get an empty profile with null values.
        Parameters:
        accessToken - will be used to get user info
        Returns:
        request call

      • revokeToken

        public ParameterizableRequest<java.lang.Void,AuthenticationException> revokeToken(@NonNull
                                                                                  java.lang.String token)
        Revoke a access/refresh token by calling revoke endpoint of your oidc provider. Revoked tokens cannot be used again.
        Parameters:
        token - access/refresh token to be revoked
        Returns:
        request call

      • revokeToken

        public ParameterizableRequest<java.lang.Void,AuthenticationException> revokeToken()
        Revoke a access/refresh token by calling revoke endpoint of your oidc provider. Revoked tokens cannot be used again.
        Returns:
        request call

      • renewAuth

        public ParameterizableRequest<Credentials,AuthenticationException> renewAuth()
        Returns new set of credentials with renewed expiration dates.
        Returns:
        request call

      • renewAuth

        public ParameterizableRequest<Credentials,AuthenticationException> renewAuth(@NonNull
                                                                             java.lang.String refreshToken)
        Returns new set of credentials with renewed expiration dates.
        Parameters:
        refreshToken - token that will be used to renew
        Returns:
        request call

      • token

        public TokenRequest token(@NonNull
                          java.lang.String authorizationCode)
        Exchange authorization code for credentials. You must set the code verifier with .setCodeVerifier method if you are not using secret keys(which should not be used with public android apps).
        Parameters:
        authorizationCode - received from authorization flow
        Returns:
        request call

      • token

        public TokenRequest token(@NonNull
                          java.lang.String authorizationCode,
                          @NonNull
                          java.lang.String redirectUri)
        Exchange authorization code for credentials. You must set the code verifier with .setCodeVerifier method if you are not using secret keys(which should not be used with public android apps).
        Parameters:
        authorizationCode - received from authorization flow
        redirectUri - uri that will be called to deliver response {applicationId}/callback by default
        Returns:
        request call
